title: Kitchen Sink NV Reserve Red (California)
description: Herbal cranberry-like aromas and flavors and moderate acidity and tannins make this wine leaner and drier than many red blends. It's built like a traditional table wine and will go well with a variety of different foods.

title: Wellington 2012 Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Somewhat flat on the palate, this full-bodied wine is ripe in blue fruit but shy in acidity.

title: Caposaldo 2015  Chianti
description: This easy-drinking blend of 75% Sangiovese, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Merlot and 5% Malvasia has spice-laced ripe black cherry aromas. The light, simple palate shows sour cherry and clove with soft tannins. Drink soon.

title: Cathedral Ridge 2013 Reid Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: Exceedingly dark, with chewy herbal tannins and high-toned somewhat volatile aromas, this is a wine that has not knit together. Black cherry, kirsch, fig and balsamic elements are scattered about, but nothing holds the center. Best to drink up soon.

title: Château Barthez 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Under the same ownership as Château de Malleret in the southern Médoc, this neighboring estate is firm and tannic with a dry hard core. That dryness and structure will probably remain even as the fruit fills out to give blackberry flavors. Less extraction would have helped.

title: Château Landonnet 2015  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A soft and ripe wine, its Sauvignon Blanc component is well into the tropical fruit spectrum. Pineapple and white fruits give the wine its full, spicy and peppery character. There is just enough acidity to keep it crisp.

title: Armida 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is solidly built with tannin and oak, a searing earthiness dulling the fruit. Tar, earth and spicy cardamom aromas domainate its full-bodied concentration and youthful ripeness.

title: Montinore 2014 Red Cap Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This brings off-putting aromas of barnyard, compost and rubber, without the fruit to compensate. Thin dilute berry flavors are buried in the mix, and it feels flat in the mouth.

title: New Kent 2014 White Merlot Rosé (Virginia)
description: This pale, cotton candy hued wine contains muted aromas of strawberry hull and raspberry. The flavors are ripe and fruity, with a hint of orange blossom. It's light bodied, but the ripe-fruit sweetness is almost textural.

title: Predator 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This overtly woody wine smells like cedar chips and fresh-cut oak and tastes like pine, menthol and cherry candy. While it's fun to pick out its different flavors, this is not what most people expect from Cabernet.

title: Harry & David 2014 Merlot (Southern Oregon)
description: The alcohol would indicate a level of ripeness which does not register in terms of flavor or density. Thin generic red fruit has a slightly burnt edge to it, and it fades out quickly.

title: André Kientzler NV Edelzwicker White (Alsace)
description: The nose suggests damp earth while the palate manages fresh clean apple fruit. The body is light and juicy and the finish dry. Drink soon.

title: Cathedral Ridge 2013 Moody Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: Sweet grapey high-toned fruit flavors are the best things here. But along with the fruit come volatile aromas, leathery, bitter tannins, and a residual impression of balsamic vinegar.

title: Conde de Altava 2015 Joven Viura (Rioja)
description: Briny pickled aromas are just clean enough to pass muster. This simple Viura is lemony and tangy on the palate, with saline-influenced flavors of citrus fruits and bell pepper. On a snappy finish, a briny flavor leads the way.

title: Narmada 2014 Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
description: On the nose, there is a keen note of charred oak. Underneath, there are faint black cherry and earthy, herbal accents. In flavor, it doesn't contain much fruit—there is more charred oak and a buttery quality. The finish is plush, with sweet oak and spice.

title: Narmada 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Virginia)
description: This wine has intense aromas of blueberry pie and vanilla, along with a barnyard note. The palate is jammy in prune and baked berry flavors. There is a yeasty and resinous quality as well. The finish is long, tart and mouthwatering, with a charred-oak note on the back.

title: New Kent 2014 White Norton Rosé (Virginia)
description: This is an interesting rosé, with a light burnt-orange hue and an orange theme throughout. It's evident from wild, sweet orange on the nose to clementine, orange blossom and orange candy flavors on the palate. There are other aromas such as cherry cough drops and raspberries, while the palate is fruit forward, with flabby acidity.

title: Steelhead Vineyards 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: An unusual blend of flavors fills this full-bodied wine. It has fruit cocktail aromas and obvious butter and butterscotch flavors as if it's trying to be a Chardonnay. The texture is rich and soft, and the butter keeps flowing on the finish.

title: Harry & David 2013 Beeson Dessert Wine Tempranillo (Southern Oregon)
description: This murky fortified wine pushes some blackberry fruit forward. The liquorous brandy flavors come up strongly, and the wine finishes with flavors of dried leaves.

title: Harry & David 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Traces of light cherry fruit give way quickly to a thin dilute finish. This is marginally riper than the non-reserve 2014 Pinot Noir.

title: EOS 2013 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very light aromas of red cherry, rose petal and potpourri barely show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are very flat, with light cranberry and a touch of licorice.

title: Yering Station 2012 Village Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: Entry-level Pinot Noir isn't an easy ask anywhere in the world. This one is marked by chocolate and espresso overtones and features a dark, earthy core that's medium-bodied and appropriately silky in texture.

title: Château Tour Saint Vincent 2014  Médoc
description: There was a generous use of wood aging here and it shows in the wood and toast flavors. The wine has bitter chocolate as well as black-currant fruits suggesting overenthusiastic extraction.

title: Cordier 2015 Enjoy la Vie  (Bordeaux)
description: This is a ripe wine, mainly from Merlot, showing fruit that is jammy and almost sweet. With attractive acidity to balance, it is soft, smooth and ready to drink.

title: Cosa Obra 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Feral in rustic compost and funk, this wine is flat and green in tone, with dried herb and sage notes forming the core of the palate.

title: Lovingston 2015 Josie's Knoll Cabernet Franc (Monticello)
description: Lively aromas of cassis, red cherry and lavender are present on the nose. The flavors of tart cherry, violet and Cran-Grape are juicy and easygoing. A light wine, there is a fresh fruitiness but not a lot of acidic lift or tannic structure.

title: Fetzer 2015 Sundial Chardonnay (California)
description: Sugared apple aromas and semi-sweet Fuji apple and honeydew flavors make this wine simply appealing. It's good for very casual meals or big crowds.

title: Veramar NV Rooster Red (Virginia)
description: This wine is plush, with aromas of blueberry, blackberry and cranberry. There are also hints of sage and red currant on the nose. The palate has more cranberry—but a bit sour—along with tart cherry and charred oak, all framed by astringent tannins and mouthwatering acidity. The finish is flavorful, but short.

title: Volver 2015 Paso a Paso Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Medicinal berry and chocolaty oak flavors come in front of a high-acid, tartaric palate. This everyday Tempranillo tastes of oak, chocolate and slightly weedy plum. Overall, it's good enough to warrant a glass or two.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Yellow Tail 2015 Pink Bubbles Sparkling (South Australia)
description: This budget-priced rosé sparkler is earthy and mushroomy, with modest berry flavors, a slightly creamy texture and citrus zest on the finish.
